subject: Purchase Order 404265-OC-11701
body:
This is the purchase order for Quote 2022497 (Catalent), with instructions on how to submit invoice for payment (after services are rendered at the end of FEB). I’m not sure if Alsu already had these instructions in QB. 
Or just in case you need a copy of the PO.
Thank you!
 
 
María
 
From:
 Purdy, Marichu <Marichu.Purdy@catalent.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, January 19, 2023 2:54 PM
To:
 Maria Fagrelius <m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Norton, Mitchell <William.Norton@catalent.com>; Anderson-Mitchell, Carla <Carla.Mitchell@catalent.com>
Subject:
 Purchase Order 404265-OC-11701
 
 
Dear Supplier,
 
Please find the PO details in the attachment and confirm back that you have received the email. Additionally, please provide the delivery date and confirm the details for requested goods are correct. 
 
If any of your contact information has changed regarding where POs should be addressed, please let us know.
 
To ensure prompt payment, all invoices must contain the Catalent PO number.
**
Please see attachment for PO Format Change
**
.
 
TO SUBMIT AN
 
INVOICE:
All Suppliers are now required to send invoices to Catalent Pharma Solutions electronically through our Tradeshift Network.  Please activate as soon as possible to ensure a smoother transition to E-Invoicing.
 
For more information about E-Invoicing, please visit our FAQ section at: 
https://catalent.support.tradeshift.com
For any questions, please email Catalent’s E-Invoicing support team at:
 
GMB-CP-ALL-TradeshiftRTC@catalent.com
 
PLEASE NOTE THAT EMAILING INVOICES CAN DELAY PAYMENT. IT IS RECOMMENDED TO USE TRADESHIFT.
 
Invoice email address
:
  
Submit via Tradeshift.com
 
PLEASE NOTE OUR MAILING ADDRESS IN WHICH TO SUBMIT INVOICES HAS CHANGED!  MAILING INVOICES 
WILL
 DELAY YOUR PAYMENT. IT IS RECOMMENDED TO USE TRADESHIFT.
 
Catalent Pharma Solutions
Site ID 117
PO Box 704004
3490 S. 4400 W.
West Valley City, UT  84170
 
FOR QUESTIONS ABOUT PAYMENTS AND SUBMITTED INVOICES:
 
Inquiry email address:
  
Apinquiries@catalent.com
 
**
Please see our important notice regarding DELIVERY OF MATERIALS attached
.**
 
All non-LTL shipments require a dock appointment 
preferably 5 days prior to delivery and must come with completed and accurate documentation with approved Catalent purchase order number and CoA/CoC (if applicable)
. Contact Catalent Receiving at 
G-OT-WIN-Receiving@catalent.com
 
or Ext. 8188. Hours of receiving are from 8am to 4pm Monday thru Friday.
 
 
Thank you for the prompt and expeditious handling of this order. If you have any questions about this order or shipment, 
reach out by replying to all who have been copied on this email.
 
Kind Regards,
 
 
Marichu C. Purdy 
Procurement Buyer 
Catalent Pharma Solutions
1100 Enterprise Drive, Winchester, KY, 40391
T
 
(859) 745-2200 x8143
M 
(859) 285-6506
www.catalent.com
more products. better treatments. reliably supplied.™
 
 
 
 
 
 
Purchase Order 404265-OC-11701 is attached for Supplier:
LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC
Catalent Pharma Solutions e-mail is for the designated recipient only and may contain privileged, proprietary, or otherwise private information. If you have received an e-mail in error, please notify the Catalent sender immediately and delete the original. Any other use of the e-mail by you is prohibited.

subject: FW: Notification of Business Process Deactivation - Supplier Name: Language and Culture Worldwide LLC
body:
Hi David,
 
Could you please follow up on the message Monica received at the end of this email chain? I replied directly, and it bounced back.
 
I suspect what triggered the message to Monica is someone tried to create a profile for us outside of the regular third-party L&D procurement process (i.e., Fieldglass) and that this duplicate is what is showing as inactive. As recently as early last year, we were receiving remittances outside of the system. We do want to double check this, though, as we have a substantial amount of outstanding and upcoming invoiced from them.
 
https://www.ap.jnj.com/
 
Let me know if you have any questions, and thanks for your help!
 
Dan
 
-
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Daniel Gough, PhD
(he, him, his)

subject: ⭐ Everything You Need to Know About Customer Reviews ⭐

subject: Re: Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hi David, 
I hope you are doing well.
I'm following up about my email below concerning the IDI assessment. If you are interested in the IDI, I would be more than happy to go ahead and send you the login credentials. Please let me know what you decide. 
😊
Thanks, 
Kaitlin 
From:
 Kaitlin Nonweiler
Sent:
 Thursday, January 12, 2023 10:13 AM
To:
 David Trincado <d.trincado@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) 
 
Hi David, 
I hope you are doing well. 
I'm reaching out to ask if you would like to take the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI). This is an assessment that we offer to clients, and new hires at LCW are invited to take it as well. I have attached the pre-read document so that you can read a little bit more about it. If you would like to take it, I will order you a login code. It takes about 20-30 minutes to complete. Then, we will schedule a 1-hour debrief to go over your results. I'll be delivering the debrief, and Jeffrey will be observing me. There is no hurry to take it. My goal is to complete the new hire debriefs by the end of February. 
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator & Coach 
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
 
Phone: 773-828-6808 (CST)

subject: How are you? LCW is curious to hear your opinion!
body:
Based upon your feedback, opinion and ideas we can create a positive working atmosphere together.
May we ask you a few questions?
 
SHARE YOUR OPINION!
 
More about the theme mood
 
Emotions drive our actions and thoughts. Your mood during work can determine how you handle stressful situations, how productive you are and how well you perform. Moods can also trigger (positive or negative) behaviors of co-workers! Therefore it is important for your team or organization to receive regular (anonymous) feedback about how you feel at work and why. In this way they can contribute to your job satisfaction and a positive working climate. 
Thanks in advance!
Safe & Confidential

subject: RE: Checking in
body:
Hey. Sorry. Just seeing this. Do you have time today around 11:30EST or 3pm EST?
 
Nicole Barile
Director of Operations
, 
LCW
 
From:
 David Trincado <d.trincado@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, January 17, 2023 5:10 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Checking in
 
Hi Nicole, 
 
Let’s touch base tomorrow for a quick phone call regarding this. I just want to let you know it had nothing to do with you at all, as you have always supported me. Me and Alisa talked about a few things this morning and I believe I set the bar too high for myself. I have been really behind the last two weeks because of Payroll, etc. And I should have communicated my frustrations better to the team. Overall, I was extremely overwhelmed, and I made a bad decision. There is a lot more to talk about, but I just want to thank you for your support. 
 
 
David Trincado
Staff Accountant, 
LCW
Email: 
d.trincado@lcwmail.com
Phone: +1 773-938-3958

|

|

|
 
LinkedIn
 -
 
 
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, January 17, 2023 1:28 PM
To:
 David Trincado <
d.trincado@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Checking in
 
Hey David,
 
I heard the news. I just heard briefly, as I was OOO (as you know), so I honestly didn’t get much detail, but I wanted to quickly touch base. I know you sent an invite for this Friday, but if you have time to chat before that – and want to – do let me know. I don’t want you to rehash everything that we will be discussing on Friday, so no need for a separate call if you don’t think it’s needed.
In short, I want to say that I’m sorry if your experience at LCW, and in your role, has not been the best. I hope we can all work together to help you and to learn from you so we can make the experience better. I’m here to support you as best I can.
 
If it helps at all, it is not uncommon to feel a bit overwhelmed here at the beginning. And, I think you starting at the time you did added a bunch of complications. We all value you here, and I know we are dedicated to supporting you as best we can!
 
Nicole
 
Nicole Barile
Director of Operations
, 
LCW

subject: New supplier - Tatyana Bessonov
body:
Hi David,
 
We onboarded another supplier for interpretation.
Can you get her setup on your side as well?
 
Thanks,
Maya

 Tatyana Bessonov <tbessonov@gmail.com>

To:
 Maya Benoit <M.Benoit@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Catalent Virtual Russian GMP Inspection: Availability Inquiry
 
Greetings Maya,  
 
Thank you for the clarification. Please find my completed and signed Agreement attached. 
 
I am looking forward to receiving the confirmation and further info re: the below assignment in due course. Thank you in advance for your prompt communication. 
 
Kind regards, 
Tatyana Bessonov, MA, CCI

On Jan 17, 2023, at 10:57 AM, Maya Benoit <
M.Benoit@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
 
Hi Tatyana,
 
Thanks already for the completed forms.
We currently don’t have a separate agreement for the interpreters we work with. In a sense you would fall under the ‘and/or other linguistic services.’ in the agreement.
So would it be possible to use this agreement for now?
 
It is a good point however, so we will take this up with our legal team for the future.
 
Thanks,
Best,
Maya
 
 
From:
 Tatyana Bessonov <
tbessonov@gmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, January 17, 2023 11:39 AM
To:
 Maya Benoit <
M.Benoit@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: Catalent Virtual Russian GMP Inspection: Availability Inquiry
 
Greetings Maya,  
 
As requested, please find attached the following: 
 
—completed profile form
—completed payment preference form
—completed W-9
—resume (for file)
 
I note that the Agreement in the attached packet is drafted for written translators. As I provide only oral interpretation services, would you have a separate agreement for interpreters? Thank you. 
 
Kind regards, 
Tatyana Bessonov, MA, CCI
ENG<->RUS Conference Interpreter 
UN * Conferences * RSI * GMP Pharma * Law
IAPTI, ATA, NAJIT
tel: 847-924-7476  * fax: 815-364-1478 *  
email: tbessonov@gmail.com
web: 
http://atanet.org/onlinedirectories/tsd_listings/tsd_view.fpl?id=14143
 
 
On Jan 17, 2023, at 8:00 AM, Maya Benoit <
M.Benoit@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
 
Hi again Tatyana,
 
Could you already complete attached forms?
This would allow us to already add you to our database while we wait on further news from this customer.
 
Thank you,
Best,
Maya
 
From:
 
Tatyana Bessonov <
tbessonov@gmail.com
>
 
Sent:
 
Friday, January 13, 2023 11:32 AM
To:
 
Maya Benoit <
M.Benoit@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 
Tatyana Bessonov <
tbessonov@gmail.com
>
Subject:
 
Re: Catalent Virtual Russian GMP Inspection: Availability Inquiry
 
Greetings Maya, 
 
 
Thank you for your inquiry. It is nice to e-meet you. As a native Russian speaker with near-native English fluency of a US citizen, I have a university degree in interpreting and 20+ of simultaneous and consecutive interpreting experience. 
 
To your inquiry, I do indeed have extensive GMP inspection interpreting experience, having serviced
 
35 GMP inspections
 
as a Russian interpreter over the last
 
6 years
—including 11 GMP inspections last year alone—which I serviced either onsite  virtually from my remote office. Thus, I am very familiar and comfortable with the inspection format, procedures and specific terminology.  The client should be rest assured, as I have serviced GMP inspections at AstraZeneca, Merck, Pfizer, Patheon, Ely Lilly, Sanofi, BMS, Genentech, AbbVie, Baxter etc. 
 
It will be a pleasure to assist Catalent KY with the upcoming inspection. 
 
I understand the interpreting service is needed virtually. My half-day fee is  $350 (up to 4 hours), so the total based on the below description will be $1,750. If any of the days  end up being longer than 4 hours (happens sometimes, but rarely), the cost will be $87.50 for each additional hour past the 4 hours. 
 
Since some sites prefer that I travel onsite for a virtual inspection, I also would like to put it out there that I am also available to travel to (and render services from) Catalent KY if Catalent colleagues would prefer. If so, the interpretation time would change to full-day fees and I’d be glad to advise re: the additional travel expenses. 
 
I trust this is helpful. I will pencil the dates in my calendar. As my work schedule changes daily, your prompt confirmation (once the PO is confirmed), is appreciated. Please feel free to reach out with any updates or questions. Thank you in advance. 
 
Kind regards, 
Tatyana Bessonov, MA, CCI
ENG<->RUS Conference Interpreter 
UN * Conferences * RSI * GMP Pharma * Law
IAPTI, ATA, NAJIT
tel: 847-924-7476  * fax: 815-364-1478 *  
email: tbessonov@gmail.com
web: 
http://atanet.org/onlinedirectories/tsd_listings/tsd_view.fpl?id=14143
 
 
 
 
On Jan 13, 2023, at 9:40 AM, Maya Benoit <
M.Benoit@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
 
Hello Tatyana,
 
 
I’m Maya and I’m part of the localization team at LCW.
We found your details on the ATA website, as we are looking for a Russian interpreter with GMP inspection experience and your profile seems to match.
 
A Pharma client of ours needs an interpreter for a virtual GMP inspection. They’re still finalizing the last details but this is the information I have so far:
Location: Virtual. The client is located in Kentucky.
Expertise: Pharma - GMP inspection
Dates: February 20-24, 2023
Times: 4 hours each day for 5 days – Most likely in the morning since the inspectors will be in Russia
Number of Inspectors: TBD
 
Please let me know if this is something you would be interested in – and also if you would be available and what your rate would be.
We still need a PO from the client so this is an inquiry for availability and pricing for now.
 
Thank you in advance,
Kind Regards,
Maya
 
 
Maya Benoit
Translation Coordinator, LCW
Email:
 
m.benoit@lcwmail.com
Phone: +1.773.977.4561

Hi,
 
I reviewed Bill.com and the PPF did not match what was actually paid out. I ended up noticing that 
Dearborn and Hartford
 were added to the form, but these are paid via CC, so that was the variance I saw (payment was not processed, so I just needed to edit the PPF). I also saw 50K was transferred into the Village bank checking account but it was not added to the PPF--I went ahead and updated that. Regardless, everything else looked good and matches.
 
I have added 
Maya Benoit’s payment
 to the PPF form. We gave her Net 15 terms so the payments should have been sent out Friday. I have added the link to her timesheet in the bill if you would like to review, but we need to pay her ASAP for 41 hours (from 12-15 to 12-31). It is ready to be processed in bill.com

subject: RE: Checking in
body:
Hi Nicole, 
 
Let’s touch base tomorrow for a quick phone call regarding this. I just want to let you know it had nothing to do with you at all, as you have always supported me. Me and Alisa talked about a few things this morning and I believe I set the bar too high for myself. I have been really behind the last two weeks because of Payroll, etc. And I should have communicated my frustrations better to the team. Overall, I was extremely overwhelmed, and I made a bad decision. There is a lot more to talk about, but I just want to thank you for your support. 
 
 
David Trincado
Staff Accountant, 
LCW

From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, January 17, 2023 1:28 PM
To:
 David Trincado <d.trincado@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Checking in
 
Hey David,
 
I heard the news. I just heard briefly, as I was OOO (as you know), so I honestly didn’t get much detail, but I wanted to quickly touch base. I know you sent an invite for this Friday, but if you have time to chat before that – and want to – do let me know. I don’t want you to rehash everything that we will be discussing on Friday, so no need for a separate call if you don’t think it’s needed.
In short, I want to say that I’m sorry if your experience at LCW, and in your role, has not been the best. I hope we can all work together to help you and to learn from you so we can make the experience better. I’m here to support you as best I can.
 
If it helps at all, it is not uncommon to feel a bit overwhelmed here at the beginning. And, I think you starting at the time you did added a bunch of complications. We all value you here, and I know we are dedicated to supporting you as best we can!
 
Nicole

subject: Notice
body:
Hey, David -
Sorry to have heard that you are resigning from LCW. I had no idea that the remit as designed was causing you the stress you referenced in your note to Alisa.
With the suddeness of your exit I can't help but wonder if there is additional information that you'd be willing to share with me. I would hate to hire someone else only to find the same conditions exist to drive them away as well.
Please let me know if you are free to chat today. Any feedback would be helpful to me as a leader of the organization. This is a critical role and I need to make sure that it is designed and supported well in order to serve the employees here.
Feel free to call me or text me at the mobile number below if you'd rather chat.
Hope to hear from you soon.
Chuck

subject: Letter of Resignation - Thank You
body:
Alisa,
 
I want to thank you for the opportunity to work here at LCW. In my short time here, I have met so many great and interesting people. However, It has been nothing short of overwhelming in terms of my position. I need to be honest with myself-I believe this position requires more relevant experience and time to live up to its required expectations. This is a bitter pill to swallow, but I need to be honest with you and say I cannot provide the relevant experience you expect for this position. I have tried my best to learn all the responsibilities, taking it as a challenge, but I believe there is a better fit out there. 
 
Please let me know what address I can send the laptop equipment back and my CC as I would like to do this asap. I was planning on resigning on Tuesday, but I do not feel that is the right choice as there is a holiday weekend coming up, so please consider yesterday as my last day.
 
The things that need immediate attention is sending out 
W9s (by Jan 27
th
) and Bill.com Payments
. 
 
Going forward, please reach out to me via my personal email if you need anything: 
Trincado11@gmail.com
 
 
David Trincado
Staff Accountant, 
LCW
Email: 
d.trincado@lcwmail.com
Phone: +1 773-938-3958

subject: Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hi David, 
I hope you are doing well. 
I'm reaching out to ask if you would like to take the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI). This is an assessment that we offer to clients, and new hires at LCW are invited to take it as well. I have attached the pre-read document so that you can read a little bit more about it. If you would like to take it, I will order you a login code. It takes about 20-30 minutes to complete. Then, we will schedule a 1-hour debrief to go over your results. I'll be delivering the debrief, and Jeffrey will be observing me. There is no hurry to take it. My goal is to complete the new hire debriefs by the end of February. 
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator & Coach

k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Protect Your Property This Season
body:
Prepare for winter.
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 
  
View as a webpage
 
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
Protect Your Property This Season 
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
For many of us, winter weather has arrived or is on its way. As always, our customers’ safety is top of mind. Here are some important practical steps you can take to help protect your property during extreme cold weather. 
  
 
  
Pipe Bursts 
  
  
Ensuring adequate heat and monitoring facilities are important steps. Our research indicates frozen pipes cause some of the most common and costliest cold weather claims (>$18K, on average). Not surprisingly, the risk of pipe bursts can increase when businesses are closed or unoccupied (e.g., due to storm closings). From schools whose students are out on break (and leave windows open) to businesses that close for a weekend, we’ve seen some very disruptive losses when pipes freeze and water flows – sometimes for days before being noticed. 
  
 
  
Slip & Falls 
  
  
Slip and fall accidents can be very impactful to your business, whether they involve your employees or someone else legally on your premises. Each year these accidents result in thousands of workers’ compensation or third party liability claims. In fact, slip and falls account for approximately 1/3 of our workers’ compensation and general liability claims. 
  
This risk can increase substantially with winter weather. What can you do to protect your employees and customers and avoid these claims? Some important steps are: 
  
  
• 
Treat all exterior areas where you expect to have pedestrian and/or vehicle traffic. Once and done is not sufficient — inspect and treat areas of potential hazard frequently. 
  
• 
Make certain the property has ample lighting during the shorter daylight hours of winter. 
  
 
 
 
We’re here to help.
 For more on how you can protect your property, see our 
online article
. As always, if and when you need us, our exceptional claim professionals stand ready to assist. 
 
 
 
  
  
  
  
Protect Your Property 
  
  
  
  
 
 
 
  
Thank you for your business. 
  
 
Mary Nasenbenny
Chief Claims Officer

subject: [Important] Your 4th Quarter Payroll Tax Reconciliation is Complete
body:
Hi,
Reconciliation runs are part of a payroll provider's normal quarter's-end reconciliation process. Zenefits Payroll is running those corrections to ensure you pay the correct amount to each tax jurisdiction where you're liable for payroll taxes.
When we do reconciliations, we look for variances between what we collected in taxes from your pay runs in the quarter and what the tax agencies expect you to pay. In some cases, we'll find variances between these two amounts. Variances are normal, and can be the result of a number of things.
Here's a snapshot of where you stand, and what will happen next:
For your Full-Service jurisdictions, we will automatically create pay runs in your account and you'll see the following net amount 
debited from 
your bank account ending in ******6303 by January 09, 2023 for $0.07 for Unemployment Tax.
For additional details, please feel free to review your 
All In One report
 from your Payroll app.
Thanks, 
Zenefits 
Questions or concerns? Visit 
help.zenefits.com
. 
© Zenefits

Hi - It is our hope that everyone sees, in the development of this policy and those like it, the importance we place on each and every one of you as trusted collaborators. We want you to do well. We want to do well by you. And we want to reward great performance and outstanding outcomes for our clients.
 
Please reach out to me or Alisa if you have any question. We will be supporting your managers in the implementation of the policy change and will work with them to ensure you have the answers you need.
 
A/C
 
 
______________________________________
Chuck Adams

Terms and Privacy Policy
 
You’ve ordered an annual subscription to Articulate 360. Please take a look at our Privacy policy (
https://www.articulate.com/privacy
) and terms of service (
https://www.articulate.com/360/terms
) as these documents define the legal agreement between you and Articulate. We may update these documents periodically. If there’s a conflict between these terms (including payment terms) and the terms of any order, purchase order, quote, order confirmation, customer or third-party portals, these terms will control, unless the parties have mutually agreed to other terms. 
Activation
 
We will endeavor to activate your subscription to Articulate 360 by the date noted above. However, if there’s a delay, we’ll postpone the subscription start date and extend the subscription period at no cost to you. You can always confirm activation status and adjustments to terms by logging into your Articulate 360 account or calling our customer care team at 1-800-861-4880. 
Account Information
 
To process this order, we need you to provide proper account information, including the appropriate email contact(s) and accurate billing information. Please keep this information updated on your Articulate 360 account profile (
https://account.articulate.com/
). 
Automatic Renewal
 
Your subscription will automatically renew on the term end date unless you cancel in accordance with our terms of service. We’ll email the contact associated with your account before renewal to provide notice of the approaching renewal date and any changes to the subscription pricing. If you'd like to make changes to your subscription before your renewal, please contact the Customer Success team at 
success@articulate.com
.

DoNotReply@dwd.wisconsin.gov
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, January 3, 2023 7:57:38 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Notice of Time to File UI Quarterly Tax and Wage Reports
 
 
Your Wisconsin Quarterly Unemployment Insurance Tax and Wage Reports and payment for fourth quarter 2022 are due on January 31, 2023. You can now login to your UI account at 
http://dwd.wisconsin.gov/ui
 and file the reports for fourth quarter 2022. If you've already filed the reports for fourth quarter 2022, no further action is required. 
You received this email because a user created Login ID subscribed to receive quarterly Time to File email reminders at this email address. This Time to File email reminder was not sent in reference to a specific Wisconsin Unemployment Insurance Account. 
If you no longer wish to receive this email, login to your account and update your email subscriptions. Email subscriptions are located in the "Other Functions" section of the Unemployment Insurance Online Services web site.
Please do not reply to this email. Questions or comments may be sent to 
taxnet@dwd.wisconsin.gov

Subject:
 What will DEI look Like in 2023
 
Hi -   RP noted this interesting article (I think it was you RP).  If so- thanks!
 
Attached is an article from a newsletter Diversity Explained.  It is a good write up, although I do not really agree with some of.  I am distributing and suggesting the following:
Could we discuss in our Monday Consulting meeting?
Everyone would be asked to read it and come with three comment/insights/ questions.  They really need to read it and weigh in.
Tamara would facilitate discussion designed to explore implications in our work.  Also, to highlight shared understanding of concepts outlined in the article. 
 
The objective is to give the group a chance to discuss and share after reading the same thing.  We will build internal capacity in DEI and consider how we can leverage in 2023.  And just learn from each other..
 
Just a thought.  Happy New Year!
 
Andrea

subject: How are you? LCW is curious to hear your opinion!
body:
Based upon your feedback, opinion and ideas we can create a positive working atmosphere together.
May we ask you a few questions?
 
SHARE YOUR OPINION!
 
More about the theme mood
 
Emotions drive our actions and thoughts. Your mood during work can determine how you handle stressful situations, how productive you are and how well you perform. Moods can also trigger (positive or negative) behaviors of co-workers! Therefore it is important for your team or organization to receive regular (anonymous) feedback about how you feel at work and why. In this way they can contribute to your job satisfaction and a positive working climate. 
Thanks in advance!
Safe & Confidential
